Speaker: guard
Dialogue: What's this, then?

Speaker: captain's voice
Dialogue: - folks, we're a little over two and a half hours from touchdown in Atlanta, but if you look out your windows on either side of the aircraft, we'll soon be crossing the southern section of the Rocky Mountains, a range which includes more than 50 peaks rising above 14,000 feet. The chain's loftiest point, Mount Elbert, at 14, 433 feet should be coming into view as we pass over central Colorado shortly..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You keep staring at that watch as if your life depended on it, Doctor..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: They're ready and waiting.  You'll soon be with old friends.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Sorry it couldn't be under happier circumstances.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: He was quite a man.  Did he know before the end you two had succeeded?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: ..not in time to save him.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You carry them together?  Safely?

Speaker: captain's voice
Dialogue: You Captain again.  We've experienced a slight but abrupt drop in cabin pressure..

Speaker: captain
Dialogue: Pan, pan, pan, Denver Center.  This is Trans Pac Flight two-two-zero-seven, 747 heavy.  We are not reading you.  We're unable to maintain cabin pressurization. We have initiated a descent to one six thousand.

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: ..it seems we have a problem, Dmitri.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You keep calling me Dmitri.  You really shouldn't.

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: You're not Dmitri?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: - no.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: - pull the NO2 tank and dump it, it's potential evidence..

Dialogue: All done, chief..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: - don't go too far ahead of me now -

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Not possible..

Speaker: wallis
Dialogue: Checkpoint Charlie plus 30, altitude minus two-zero-thousand.  Airspeed one-seven- niner knots..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: It's that time.  Go.

Speaker: voice
Dialogue: Terrain, terrain.  Pull up, pull up.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Whoaa..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You're welcome.

Speaker: electronic voice
Dialogue: Identity confirmed.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Good morning, Mr. Hunt.

Speaker: swanbeck's voice
Dialogue: Your mission, should you choose to accept it, requires you to recover a stolen item, designated Chimera.  Essential to the mission is the recruitment of a civilian -- a Miss Nyah Nordoff-Hall.  She is a highly capable professional thief currently active in Spain.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: If I let you know where I'm going -

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Do you know me?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: No.  Should I?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No.  You just looked as if you did.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: No.  Just as if I'd like to.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Oh.  Well.  I think that can be arranged.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Not tonight.  Bad timing.  Sorry -

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: There's not enough time in the world for any of it to be bad.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Look, it's either you or the rent and I don't mind telling you it's not an easy choice.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What if I pay the rent?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Uh-huh.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Uh-huh?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Go find the wealthy lady you came with and next time we meet - I'll pay your rent.  Now bugger off.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Mmmm.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Decisions, decisions.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Think you're the only one who can pick a lock?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I see.  You're not just another pretty face..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I take it you prefer tenors.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Would you mind if I'm on top?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Oh, either way works for me.

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: You're never gonna find it there.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Damn it!  Find what?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: His ex-wife's Bulgari necklace that goes up for auction Tuesday.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: - right..where is it?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Far right.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Where's the bloody -

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: - torque wrench.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: - this is very disconerting..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Hey, you put me here.  I just do what I'm told.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: - right..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I wouldn't do that.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Do what?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: That.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, Senor de l'Arena the goods news is that the heat sensors were activated.   But Miss Nordoff-Hall, my associate -

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: - did feel that she had rather too long to work on the safe before they triggered the alarm, isn't that right Miss Hall?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Oh yes.  Absolutely.  Much too long I should yes.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Under the circumstances I think we would recommend re-setting the senors to respond to a lighter load.  How do you feel about forty kilos, Miss Hall?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Indeed.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, Senor de l'Arena, there's no reason to disrupt your party any longer.  we have some further concerns about the disposition of your security guards, which you'll receive in our written report by fax in the morning, hard copy to follow.  Shall we?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: The necklace?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I'm missing something here, aside from a 500,000 pound necklace.  Even after I botched the job, I could've walked out of there with the bloody thing.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: At least you walked.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: If you weren't going to let me get away with it, why did you let me go thru with it?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Wanted to see how good you were. I'm hoping we might work together.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: May I say something, no offence?  You look like a gigolo, you sound like a thief, you act like a cop - what the bloody hell do you have in mind?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Working under adverse conditions.  Highly adverse conditions.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Sounds smashing.  I'm in.  Muchacho, mi carro, por favor!  Now be serious.  You couldn't possibly want me off tonight's performance..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You didn't do that badly.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: You're apologizing for me?  Quite the gentleman..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Not really.  I triggered the alarm..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Hey, the Bulgari job last week was flawless.  And I've always been partial to pale yellows.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I don't do laundry, or put up with cheeky bastards who set me up on their territory so they can poach on mine.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Hola..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Hi.  Would you mind slowing down?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Where did you get this number?  I don't even have it!

Speaker: ethan' voice
Dialogue: Would you like it?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Pull over and listen to me, will you? Just listen..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Listen to what?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I need your help and I thin you can use mine.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Your help?  What are you talking about?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Scotland Yard, Interpol, every Dutch authority.  I can make them go away.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Oh bloody hell.  You're a spy.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I deserved that.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Slow down, slow down.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Uh-oh.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No!

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Oh..oh..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Don't look down.  Just..look at me. That's it..that's it..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: What's you name?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Ethan Hunt.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Well, Ethan Hunt, what is it you want to talk to me about?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: ...more than I thought..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Awfully short notice..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Care to wait a decent interval?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Who wants to be decent?..

Dialogue: So what've you got against spooks?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: When they've got your recruiting technique?  Not a thing.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Oh.  Well..this isn't exactly by the book.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: They've got a book for this?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: They've got a book for everything.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: The only other spook I knew was a liar. Charming but absolutely incapable of telling the truth.  He'd lie about his favorite color.  But then I reckon it's an occupational hazard.  All spies really do is conceal the truth and tell lies.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Not revealing information doesn't necessarily make someone a liar.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: That's not the point.  In the end what spies rely on is the one thing they think they know that you don't.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Which is?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: That they're lying.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: So where did I got right?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: You're not a liar.  Or you're an awfully good one..  ..this thing these blokes pinched..

Dialogue: I don't know that they 'pinched' it. Don't even know that they're blokes.

Dialogue: Well, then, what I am I doing here?  I assume I'm meant to be some sort of thief-to catch-a-thief..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: So do I.  Sort of.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Spoken like a spook..you ever afraid?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Of what?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Ask a question, you get an answer!..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Damn, you're beautiful.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: That's because I'm on my back.

Dialogue: I don't think so.

Dialogue: Are you gonna be here a while?

Dialogue: Si, senor.

Dialogue: I'll pick'em up on my way out, okay?

Dialogue: Sorry I didn't let you know where I was.

Dialogue: Don't be.  Wouldn't be on vacation if you did.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well.  You're sorry and I'm sorry.

Dialogue: Why did you phrase it like that?

Dialogue: Like what?

Dialogue: 'You're sorry and I'm sorry.'

Dialogue: You gotta be kidding.

Dialogue: Well, Dmitri!  How are you?..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: ..I'm fine..and you?

Dialogue: I'm fine..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'm fine and you're fine..

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: I'm fine too.. I'm fine and you're fine - do you remember, dear fried, how you got Sergei and I to repeat those lines from Dr. Strangelove and we gave you the name of that silly Soviet Premier because we didn't know your name?..In those days, you not only saved our lives, you saved our sanity.  'Now, then Dmitri - we have this little problem': Every search for a hero must begin with something that every hero requires; a villain.  Therefore, in a search for our hero, Bellerophon, we created a monster Chimera.  I beg you, Dmitri, come to Sydney and accompany me to Atlanta immediately. However we travel, I must arrive at me destination, within 20 hours of departure. Forgive this fanciful explanation, but for now prudence dictates that I communicate nothing but the gravest urgency. I fear I can entrust this to no one but you, Dmitri.  as we say, 'I'm sorry and you're sorry'..

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Let me ask you something.  You have any idea what the hell he's talking about?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: An idea, yeah.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Like?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Like it's a good idea to pick him up in a hurry.  And a bad idea to fly him on a commercial carrier.  So let's get on with it.  He's still in Sydney?

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Dr. Vladimir Nekhorvich is dead.  So is his colleague, Gradski, but that happened earlier.  We had Nekhorvich on a flight from Sydney that crashed in the Rockies..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: If he didn't want to go anywhere without me, how did you get him on the flight?

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: You were there.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: When I couldn't find you, I had to replace you.  Sean Ambrose was the obvious choice. He double you, what?  Two, three times?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Twice.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: What did you think of him?

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Not necessarily.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Airline record list Captain Harold Macintosh as the pilot for Flt 2207.  as far as the media and all governmental agencies are concerned, Captain Macintosh died on the flight, but in fact he missed it.  He did, however make the next flight - in cargo, stuffed into a rather small suitcase considering his size.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: So there's one thing we know Ambrose doesn't.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Then you do think it was Ambrose.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Whatever Nekhorvich was carrying Sean wanted and he wanted to conceal the fact that he took it.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Enough to kill Nekhorvich and two hundred innocent passengers?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Sean feels he hasn't done the job unless he leaves a lot of hats on the ground.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: The question is why?  What was this Chimera Nekhorvich was carrying?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Right now only Ambrose knows that.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: In any case, you've got to recover Chimera and bring it to us.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: In order to do that, I've got to figure out how he plans to make money with it.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: - right.  In fact since the plane went down our banking sources have confirmed a marked increase in the stock pilling of cash in terrorists accounts.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: 'Terrorists?'

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Well you know Nekhorvich's history. You're the one who got him out of the Soviet Union was it still in bio- weapon business.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: If that's what you're thinking Ambrose would have set up a bidding situation with any number of buyers before he got on the plane.  Locating him in time to stop something like that -

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: - is where Miss Hall comes in.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Excuse me?

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Miss Hall and Ambrose had a relationship which he took very seriously.  She walked away and he's wanting her back ever since.  We believe she's our surest and quickest way of location him.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: And then what?

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Then makes sure she continues to see him. Gets him confide in her and report to you.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You made it sound as if I was recruiting her for her skills as a thief.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Well, then I mislead you.  Or you made the wrong assumption.  Either way we're asking her to resume a prior relationship, not do anything she hasn't already done.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: She's got no training for this kind of thing.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Go to bed with a man and lie to him? She's a woman.  She's got all the training she needs.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I don't think I can get her to do it.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: You mean it'll be difficult.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Very.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Well it's not mission difficult, Hunt. It's mission impossible.  Difficult should be a walk in the park for you.  If you can think of a quicker way to get to Ambrose, you're welcome to try.  Oh, by the way, you might want to take a look at these..if you have any further qualms about getting her to do the job.

Speaker: street vendor
Dialogue: Senor, senor!  Your flowers.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Yes.  They're very nice..

Dialogue: What's the population of Seville any idea?

Dialogue: Five, six-hundred thousand.

Dialogue: There's nearly 2 million in London.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: And six billion in the world.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: That's lot of people out there..how many of them, I wonder, are capable of something like that?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Sean Ambrose, for one.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Right...

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Not that it matter much but..I seem to recall you staying something like, 'I was hoping we could work together.'

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: This wasn't what I had in mind, Nyah.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: But it is what you'd like me to do. so tell me to do it..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Go and insinuate yourself back into Sean's life.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I'd like a little more conviction..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: So would I.  But it's not mine to give.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: You've either got it or you don't.  Let your conscience be your guide?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Something like that.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: But I don't have a conscience.  I'm a bloody thief.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You can be a thief and have a conscience.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: No.  You can be a thief and have a conscience:  Not me.  Why did you have to tell me about this!  What do I have to do to get away from this guy?  When you're with him, he messes about with your head every waking moment..even now I'll be at some out-of- the-way-place, a tin of caviar and a bottle of Crystal shows up at the table, with two glass, God knows how he finds out at any given moment where I am in the world but he does.  And it looks like he's done it again.  You know his definition of a  true paranoid?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I don't.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Someone in possession of all the facts.  Are you telling me I have to do this?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Generally, I don't favor coercing someone. Not when there's a chance my life could end up in their hands.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: And that's the only reason?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Can you think of a better one?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Not me.  I was just hoping you might..or that..somehow in the course of business this got personal as well as physical.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Look, would it make you feel better if I didn't want you to do this?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Much.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Then feel better!..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Sean will never be anything but suspicious if he picks up some sort of 'yoo-hoo-I'm- not-nad' message.  Not after the way we broke up.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What wouldn't make him suspicious?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Probably that I needed him in some urgent way..destitute - in serious trouble..the kind I couldn't possible sort out myself..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Serious trouble, Nyah, is something I can always arrange..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: This little chip sends a coded signal that can be picked up only by our computer.

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: When it's in your ankle we can track you within three feet of anywhere in the world.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Look, I can't run your arrest in CNN, but I guarantee he's monitoring every law enforcement agency in the world, for what they might be saying about him, if nothing else - he's got the ability and, we assume, the desire to get you out of there.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: This doesn't seem to be accomplishing much.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, I mean it's not a total loss.  It is keeping a very capable thief off the street..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Very funny..maybe he has heard and doesn't want to know.  Maybe he's lost interest.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Your lawyer to see you.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: What lawyer?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, here we go.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Stop and look for something in you purse..kneel down..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Limo's waiting.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: - Ambrose will have counter-surveillance second to no one's.  When and if he contacts you, push this button before you actually end up under his roof it'll scramble your transmission to us.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: When will you be there?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Before you are.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: How can you possibly?  I've got to get right on the plane.  I'm leaving now.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You don't trust me.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Oh, I do.  But as we know I'm a very poor judge of character.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: He's got you on Qantas flight 2735.  It's going to be delayed.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Yes?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You'll be fine.  I'm going to lose you.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Ethan, you take care of yourself, I'll take care of myself because if push comes to shove, I'm gonna bail - and without giving two week notice.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, forewarned is forearmed.  And while we're at it, be especially sensitive to any sudden change in Ambrose's plans, especially any involving you..

Dialogue: Welcome to Australia, mate.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Thanks - mate.

Dialogue: It's the transponder.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Put in the coordinates and let's get a visual.  The visuals aren't coming up.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: The satellite doesn't work as fast as I do.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Yeah, I've heard about you, Luther, and I just want to tell you it's an honor and a pleasure to be working with you blokes, whoaa!  That's some transponder!

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: It certainly is.  How did we get so lucky?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Damn.  Just when it was about to get interesting.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: It's okay.  She scrambled the transmission.  Luther, continue feeding the GPS her position.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Can't we speed this up.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: With what?  This is the only computer that'll do this.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: - right.  Now there's a bloke who knows how to deliver a proper welcome.  Don't get me wrong, mate.  You were quite hospitable.  Is it him, then?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: It is, Billy.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Then we got'em!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: We don't know what we've got because we don't know what he's got, where he's got it or what he's doing in Sydney with it.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Not much luggage.

Dialogue: I left in a bit of a hurry.  I'm terribly grateful, Sean.

Dialogue: How grateful?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Well that depends.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: On what.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: How hard you had to work to get me out of there..how in the world did you ever find me?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: How I usually find you, Nyah.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: How do you that.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Magic...

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Ahh..

Dialogue: No flies on her.  No bugs either.  She's clean.

Dialogue: Well you know his blokes'll place the OSCOR in his annex, where else if you're pinpointing transmitters, video signals, covert chip cameras, anything radiating, oscillating..

Dialogue: - or hard wired, right.  First line of perimeter defence'll run from the back of the dock to the front of the house. Whatever moves burps or bleep is gonna be picked up to a height of twenty feet. Basically impenetrable, I'd say.

Dialogue: Ethan, here's Nekhorvich, and here's his boss

Dialogue: Oh well, if that's how you feel about it.

Dialogue: We at out state-of-the-art solar powered Biocyte building recognized that eternal vigilance is the price of health.. whether it's funding the teaching center at the Royal Prince Edward Hospital, removing aerosol products from the marker or braving the influenza quarantine at Bruny island late last month..at Biocyte your life..is our life's work..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Mmmm.

Dialogue: Thought you could use a little something to wear.

Dialogue: You're not interested in seeing how it looks.

Dialogue: ..therefore in a search for our hero, Bellerophon, we created a monster, Chimera.

Dialogue: Nekhorvich specialized in recombining DNA molecules.  In the myth, Bellerophon killed Chimera, a recombinant monster with the head of a lion and the tail of a serpent who plagued the ancient world.  I think Nekhorvich has created a monster virus in Chimera and apparently the means to kill it in Bellerophon.

Dialogue: That simple, huh?

Dialogue: Why not?

Dialogue: Did you say something?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Only because..it's spring..chalk it up  - to spring fever.

Dialogue: Won't do, love.  It's not spring.  It's nearly autumn..You're in Oz.  everything's upside down and backwards here.

Dialogue: Maybe that's it, then.  Everything's upside down and backwards...

Dialogue: Luther..get us everything you can on the outbreak of influenza on Bruny Island last month, including photos of the victims.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Right.  I guess there aren't many flu epidemics in the middle of summer.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Yeah?  I've just rolled up a snowball and tosses it into hell.

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: Now we'll see what chance it has.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Twenty-four mil..

Speaker: ambrose's voice
Dialogue: Thirty-seven million pounds.  That's a promising bid.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: We'll need this at the track.  Well then. Sorted.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: From her point of view or mine?

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Wasn't exactly gagging for it when she left you six months ago..The question is, do you trust her?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: One considers her timing, of course - getting nicked within a week of the plane going down.  Suggestive, even borderline suspicious, but hardly conclusive.

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Well, you've thorough about it, at any rate.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Tell me, Hugh.  You don't exactly hang on Nyah's every word and gesture, do you? Fairly ratty nail, that.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: You're not scrutinizing any casual shrug for some hair-splitting nuance, are you?

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Sean, please..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Suppose she is some sort of Trojan horse sent in by IMF to spy in us, why should I deny myself the pleasure of a ride or two? Or don't you think I can learn more from her than she can from me?

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: I do!..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Now Hugh, you must realize that some of us have the burden of sex to deal with..and my dear chap.  I may or may not know why she thinks she's here, but I'm willing to take the risk, because Hugh, I am gaging for it..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: You won.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I suppose I did.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: What made you pick that nag?  She'd never won a bloody thing.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: 'Thief in the Night?'

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Say no more.  I'm off to grab a drink. Still favor Bellinis?

Speaker: a voice
Dialogue: Naturally Vain..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Pardon me?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: 'Naturally Vain.'  In the fourth. Check her out.  She's due.

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: You can speak as if I'm right by your side.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Where are you?

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: At the mounting enclosure, just off the tracks at two o'clock.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: How's it going?  Everything okay?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Just like old times.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Just like old times?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Just about..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Tell me who you've run into at Ambrose's.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Near as I can tell, there's at least a half-dozen other blokes about the place. Maybe more.  Hugh Stamp, an old mate of Sean's, is the only one I recognize, bit of a creep and then some..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: We know him.  He's over your left shoulder, looking right at you as you go on..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: - Michael, his driver's an Aussie, new to me.  Then there's the blokes in the annex at the back of the house.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Have you met them?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Annex is strictly off limits to me and they never come to the main house, Michael even takes their meals to them all but shoves them under the door.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I've no doubt.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Ambrose is meeting some bloke in the bar. Big bloke, ginger hair. They're into something.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'll be damned.  It's McCloy, the Biocyte CEO.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Nekhorvich's boss?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Yep.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Ambrose has photographs of newspapers with loads of money piled on them -- thirty- seven million on the London Times.  What's that about?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Bids from possible Chimera buyers -- to prove that as of the date on the newspaper those bids are back up by earnest money --

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Looks like Ambrose is showing McCloy how to use a digital camera..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Whatever McCloy's looking at, he's not happy about.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Ambrose just pulled the memory card out of the digital camera and put it into an envelope, put it in his inner left jacket pocket...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Left jacket pocket?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Roger that.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Confirm.  Left jacket pocket.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Left jacket pocket confirmed.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Nyah, Ambrose is heading back.  There's an enveloped inside --

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: -- his left jacket pocket.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Affirmative.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Where do I meet you?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Betting table twelve off the paddock. Nyah, are you up to this?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I'll muddle through.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: See anything you like?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Yeah.  Naturally vain -- but they're about to close the betting table and I haven't a sou..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Nyah!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Billy, make sure Nyah's not followed.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: No worries, mate.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Would you mind terribly?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I've no doubt..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Hold on.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: To win?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: What else?

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: Luther, smallest digital you got.  Ready to transmit.  Betting table twelve.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Sorry about that, mate, that must've really - aggrhh!..

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Say again?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Aggrhh-aggrhh-aggrhh...

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Whatever you're about in future, watch your step.  Never know who you might run into...

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Where's the loo then?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: - aggrhh-aggrhh-aggrhh...

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: How'd you do?  Don't turn around.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I managed.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You noticed.  What're you going to do? Spank me?

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: Stamp's out of the loo.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: There in twenty, Ethan..

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: Stamp's a little shaky, but headed your way, mate.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Copy that.  Who do you like?  In the race?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: What race are we talking about?

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: He's heading down the stairs, now..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I want you out of Ambrose's place.

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: He's one tier from the bottom.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I want you out of there.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Why?  What's happened. What did you see?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Thirty steps..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Nyah, you've done more than enough.  Even the best of snake charmers get bit.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Ethan, tell me -

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: Twenty, nineteen..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I want you out of Australia!  ..I don't know how much more plainly I can put it.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: How do you suggest I go about it?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: He's touched your heart.  You're overwhelmed.  You need to think it over. You'll meet him somewhere in a month.  If You're not out in 48 hours I'm coming in and getting you out.  Give me the ear piece.

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Get your bet down?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Just..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Your nag is making a run for it on the outside!  Bloody hell, Nyah!

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Well, that's good, isn't?

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: Dr. Segi Gradski, Nekhorvich's colleague and lifelong friend..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Six hours later.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Here's a victim from the Bruny Island outbreak.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Oh, happy day.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Nekhorvich said 'However we travel, I must arrive at my destination within 20 hours hours of departure.'

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: To Australia.  It's made so many convicts feel at home.  Here's hoping it does the same for you..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Sean, there's something I've been meaning to talk to you about... Isn't going to be easy for me to say.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Then don't say it.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I don't know what to do about you, Sean. I'm more than a bit muddled.  I need time.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: To do what?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Sort it all out.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: And you're going to have time.  There's been a change of plans.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: A change of plans?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Yes.  We won't be able to have dinner tonight.  Something's come up.  I hope you don't mind.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Oh, no, not at all.  Maybe just a bit.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Ulrich will be about.  He'll look after you.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Lovely.

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: I thought you were going to dinner.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Hugh, take care of the Nekhorvich memory card.

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Where is it?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: In the envelope in my pocket.  My right.. jacket..pocket..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Chimera attacking human blood..

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Ambrose obviously got these from Nekhorvich on the plane.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: What manic invents  disease like that in the first place?  Why would he do it?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I don't know, but Nekhorvich was not a manic.  Get me a twenty on Nyah.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: She must still be on the property.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I told her to get outta there.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: George.  George.  George.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Bloody room..just..shut your eyes, shut your eyes.

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: A visit from an old friend.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: What's happening here?  You're dead!

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: Fatigued, certainly.  But dead is a little extreme.  On the other hand, when me dear Gradski had your pulse and blood pressure he has less than ten hours to live.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: It was in the bloody papers, on the telly..what's this about Gradski?

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: You are infected with Chimera, my friend.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: International, please.  I'd like to make a reservation on the next available flight tonight.

Speaker: operator
Dialogue: Where to?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Where is next available flight going?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Fine.  I'll take it.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Ulrich?..Ulrich!...

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Easy, easy, easy, shhh!

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Oh Ethan!..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Are you okay?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I am now.  Get me out of here.  Just get me out of here.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: It's going to be okay.

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: No use, my friend.  The medical staff wants no part of this.  Doctors don't fancy the idea of dying any more than anybody else.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: How could I possibly be infected?

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: That's exactly what Gradski said - 27 hours before he died.  With Chimera, the most minute exposure can be fatal.

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: But then you shouldn't be feeling to ill. not for another three of four hours anyway.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: You have Bellerophon.

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: Do I?

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: You took it!  All of it!  And what if I need it?

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: 'If?'  My, my, my...the five hundred people on Bruny Island that you deliberately infected with Chimera needed it as well.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Oh, please!  How was I to know they had to be treated with Bellerophon within twenty hours?

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: By asking me.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: You still don't get it, do you?  You want to make an omelet, you break a few eggs - I needed to know just how bad the disease was - in the real world, not the lab.  And you never know til you try.  You thought you were genetically splicing together strains of influenza to create a cure for all influenzas.  But I saw you creating a disease so terrible in Chimera that the cure would be priceless.

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: You wanted the disease in order to peddle the cure.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Well, the thought had occurred to me.  I needed Chimera in order to peddle Bellerophon.  For hero to be appreciated, you need a monster. Now that's not so difficult to understand, is it?  Look, time was a shot of penicillin could knock off every bloody bug in the zoo!  Not anymore!..have you any idea the R&D money it takes to float one little pissy boutique antibiotic that's barely effective against one strain of one bacterium?  If I couldn't makes money killing the microscopic little shits that are out there, you'd help me put one out there I can make on!..there it is.  I've confessed.  I, John C. McCloy, am in business to make money.  Lilly's making billions feeding Prozac to depressed dogs.  Pfizer doesn't even know where to put the money they're making on Viagra, and let me tell you that shit didn't do a thing for me even at twice the recommended dose, Jesus, who do I have to screw to get a a break!..now get me out of here, get me treated and let's go back to work!..

Speaker: nekhorvich
Dialogue: You know, I think it's a little late for that.  Do give my regards to Gradski if you see him.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Ethan, you know what frightens me most when I'm with him?..the thought of never seeing you..how are we getting out of here?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Nyah, it's very important not do anything to alarm Ambrose..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: What?  You told me to get out of here.  I thought you were here to collect me.  I was so relieved.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No time to explain.  You've done well, and we're so close.  So close.  It's critical that you do whatever Ambrose asks.  Don't worry - it'll be over soon.. That's a promise.. Come on, now off you go!

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: So Ambrose has Bellerophon and McCloy's got Chimera.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: There guys are walking around with different halves of the same dollar bill?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Ambrose got Bellerophon from Nekhorvich on the plane, but he didn't get the Chimera virus.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Yeah.  Why else would he come back to Australia?  If he had them both, he could sell them anywhere.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I kill Chimera at Biocyte and he's sitting on a cure without a disease.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: You've got the voice print, I'll get us in..

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: You were right.  Hunt stung McCloy tonight.  He knows.  They'll be going into Biocyte...

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Good..then we go where he'll be, don't we?  Well done, Hugh.  Well done.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: You're home, guv'ner.  Home..

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: - where's George.  My regular driver. Where is he?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Took ill, guv'.  Touch of the flu. They say it's going around.  Nasty business. Mind you don't catch a chill now.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Luther, do you have the building up and running?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Sorry, that it a Biocyte facility, their storage structure..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Nyah still on the property?

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: She hasn't left it.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Okay, here you go -

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Let's start from the inside out.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: All storage and production of Chimera is done here, in this lab on the forty-second floor, the heart of the building.

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: Chimera itself is kept in two places: in production vials in an incubation room and housed in a small airtight chamber - inside three injection guns.

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: Mate, you kill it in both places, we're laughin' and we go home.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Now how to get in there.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: No garage entrance.  Lobby's protected by five guards on rotating patrol.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: If you look at Hunt's operational history, he invariably favors misdirection and deception. For a start he won't go into Biocyte from the ground where he has to risk confrontation with security.

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: The atrium?  One of a kind.  Runs down the center of the building.  Provides 24-hour natural light via mirrors and daylight storage cells.  Optimal growing conditions for the virus.  Ends in a glass floor which doubles as part of the lab's ceiling.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Hey, atrium roof closes at sundown.

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: And if the louvers are open for more than thirty seconds at night, the Civil Emergency alarms are tipped.  Those even I can't stop.  Thirty seconds total to get you in and the cable out.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Security?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Thirty-second opening in the roof and a 250-foot drop.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'm not waiting 48 hours.  When we're done at Biocyte, if she's not out of Ambrose's, I'm going in and getting her out.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: No, Hunt will prefer to engage in some sort of acrobatic insanity to enter Biocyte somewhere through the atrium where security is minimal..

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Package away in five..four..three.. two..one...

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: I'm not ready!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'm gone..

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: C'mon!  C'mon!  C'mon!

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: ..nineteen..eighteen..seventeen...

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: ..sixteen..fifteen..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Luther, I'm looking at security.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Alarm in cosmetics.

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: Cable's clear.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Transponder activated..Reading package and Cable is clean.  He's on his way.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: I am. She is.

Speaker: ambrose's voice
Dialogue: If Hunt actually manages to squeak thru the atrium he's liable to make it to Chimera before we will..

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Five and a half minutes.  He's breached the hot zone..

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Alert.  Chimera-working-seed-stock-pH-and- temperature-level-outside-optimal range.

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: How're we doin', then?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: He should've have killed the virus in the incubation area..Nyah's exited the elevator on the same level as the lab.

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: What can we do' mate?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Hope he kills all the bugs before the yellow dot gets to the red one.

Speaker: computer voice
Dialogue: Subject is contaminate free.  Zero contaminate factor.  Subject contaminate free.

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: He's still got three injection guns in the test lab..They're loaded with doses of Chimera which he'll destroy by firing into a hyper-thermal chamber.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: - twenty-seven, twenty-six, twenty-five, come on, Ethan we're almost there!  I-I'm off sensitive for this..

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Oh - oh - oh -

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Get it.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Those were two explosions, your van and your safehouse, in case you didn't hear them both -- I believe that means you've also lost a friend.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: And you couldn't walk to tell me about it.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Hold your fire, dammit!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Fight a bit of a cold..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: And you're happy about that?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Beats fighting the flu, I'm here to tell you.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: You know, that was the hardest part of having to portray you.  Grinning like an idiot every fifteen minutes.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I would've thought the hardest part was exercising restraint.  Curbing that pressing need of your to get your gun off.  You were in such a hurry to knock off that 747, you never figured out where the virus really was.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: I knew where it was.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Oh.  then you knew the only way could smuggle the live virus to the CDC scientists in Atlanta was by injecting himself and using his own bloodstream as a Petri dish, doing it inside of twenty hours so he could take the anti-virus and still have it be effective.  You knew that while you were knocking him off and destroying the very thing you came for.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Stop!  Put a sock in it!  Hit that bloody gun and you'll spray the bloody virus all over the place!

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: There it is, guys, the last of it.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Yep.  You've provided us with a golden opportunity to have both the bug and the bug killer.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What was the top bid?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Why, you going to make me a better offer?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Than thirty-seven million pounds?  Not really.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Somebody's been slipping you our mail. Come on out here, you bad girl.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: She doesn't belong here, Sean.  Let her go.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: She wouldn't  be here if it wasn't for you, Hunt.  from this moment you're responsible for what happens to her, and if you're looking out for her well-being, I suggest you advise her to pick up the gun and bring it to me.  Ball's in your court, Hunt.  What've you got to say? Nyah's waiting for your answer.

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: Ethan, Nyah's in the building!  Do you copy?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Oh, Hunt, please! One can't hold Nyah responsible for her actions..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: In other words, you're calling her a flake.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: You know women, mate.  Like monkeys, they are.  Won't let go of one branch til they've got a grip on the next...get it, Nyah.  I'll cover you.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: This isn't exactly working out the way you thought it would, Ethan.  Sorry.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: You..bitch!

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: You're not going to shoot, Sean.  Not this bitch.  She's worth thirty-seven million pounds.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: What did you think you were doing!

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I wasn't thinking!  Just..trying to keep you from getting hurt, that's all.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: - you who don't have a conscience.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I guess I lied..You can't get both of us out of here, can you?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Then you'll have to kill me before it's too late.  Before I start killing people.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: I'm infected with Chimera.  You know you don't have a choice.  Just do it now.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: We've got 19 hours and 57 minutes before you start killing anybody.  I'll get Bellerophon into your system by then. Just stay alive.  I'm not gonna lose you.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: 'Dreaming of Birds and Flying Fox,' 'Bushfire Dreaming,'  'Wind Dreaming,' -- oddly appropriate -

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Not yet.  We did manage to pull any sensitive equipment and material out of our safehouse wreckage.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: We could lock down passport control and all ports of authority, but that won't stop Ambrose, and beyond him, we don't know who else we're looking for -- all terrorist bank accounts of which we're aware are stable.  No deposits, no withdrawals.  Therefore no suspects.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: We think we've got our finger on the buyer.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Do you?  Even assuming you're able to prevent Ambrose selling Chimera, you've now got an additional problem.  You destroyed all of Chimera at Biocyte.  If Ambrose is going to sell Chimera now, he'll have to do it by taking a pint or so of Miss Hall's blood to market.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Yes, I believe that's right.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: But that leaves another seven or eight pints of Chimera.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You mean that leaves Miss Hall.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Yes, I believe that's right.  Now my understanding is that 20 hours after exposure, the victim becomes infectious. Highly infectious.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: She sacrificed herself..

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Brave girl.  If you can get hold of Bellerophon with the time limit, you may spare her the ultimate sacrifice.  But in either case you've got less than nine hours to kill her or cure her.  After that it's out of our hands and a matter of worldwide material law.  And Hunt.  However you obtain it, we want you to preserve a sample of Chimera.  Bring it back alive.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Aren't you even curious?  About why she did it?

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: No.  I can't afford to be curious.  And neither can you, Hunt..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Feel like pleading for your life?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Not as much as you feel like hearing it.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: God damn it, Nyah!  Why did you do it?  Why did you save that bastard?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: If it'll make you feel any better I won't do it again.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: If it'll make you feel any better, you're going to take a lot of Aussies with you and make me a lot of money.

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: In just a few hours you can be assured of going down in history as the typhoid Mary of Oz.  G'day.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Luther?..Luther.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Ethan, I keep telling you there's not a chance of locating Nyah til I access the satellite and there's not a chance of doing that til I get this thing booted up and running!  How much time does she have left?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Ninety-seven minutes, twenty-seven seconds.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Before we kill her or cure her..

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Wrong.  All we've got to worry about is Ambrose.  Nyah will take care of Nyah.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Unless we dose her with Bellerophon on the next ninety-seven minutes, Nyah will kill herself.  So, first things, first. Swanbeck said there's no cash movement from any monitored terrorist accounts.

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: Confirms what Ambrose is gonna do -

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: Ethan's out from under the bridge and on the south-east face..

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: Ethan, Ambrose and his tem have over the bridge -

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Copy that.

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: You all right, mate?  From here it looks like very security.  What's it look like like from there?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Risky.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Breached the structure at the ten o'clock grating.  In the tunnel moving toward the target.

Speaker: chemist
Dialogue: It's a DNA match.  The blood's loaded with Chimera.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Well, then.  You've got both the virus and the anti-virus, Chimera and Bellerophen. Which means I've thirty million for you

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Not exactly.  Wallis?

Speaker: wallis
Dialogue: More like two-two point two million.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: In any case we don't want your cash.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Then what do you want?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Stock, Mr. McCloy.  Stock options, to be a little more precise..  How quickly can you manufacture more of the antivirus.

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: Ethan, just picked up an Ambrose call - Nyah's been dropped off.  I think she's alive.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Where is she?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Somewhere in Sydney.

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: Ethan?  Do you copy?

Speaker: ethan's voice
Dialogue: 'Somewhere in Sydney?'  Care to harden the target?

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: Can't.  Until I can get the GPS up on our computer..it's still down..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: The clock is ticking..

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Bellerophen?  No time at all once I've got it.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Good.  Biocyte stock is just a week or two away from going through the roof.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: An outbreak of Chimera.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Where?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: In downtown Sydney for a start.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: -- now here's the way it's going to work..Wallis, the shares outstanding are..

Speaker: wallis
Dialogue: Ninety-three point four million.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Outrageous.  I won't let you take control of my company.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Run that bastard down.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: We're running short on time, Mr. McCloy. We've got to conclude our business.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: Yes, start the transfer.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Follow it.  Let me know.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You broke our deal.

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: You're too trusting.  Raise your hands slowly.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Keep it going.

Speaker: stamp's voice
Dialogue: Sean, this rat's reached the end of the maze.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Is he alive?

Speaker: stamp's voice
Dialogue: More or less.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Bring him to me.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: We're due to take off.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Not for seven more minutes.

Speaker: wallis
Dialogue: Sean.  Transfer complete.

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: What exactly do you intend to do with him?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Ethan?  Ethan?  Do you copy?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, mate, maybe this is one of those times we shouldn't follow orders.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: What have you got to say for yourself. Hunt?  Any last words?

Speaker: stamp
Dialogue: Afraid he's got no choice.  I believe I broke his jaw.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Hugh, I'm impressed..

Speaker: mccloy
Dialogue: What do you intend to do?

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: You needn't watch.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: - right.  We don't have a lot of time, Hunt.  whatever you've got to say, say it now.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Man at your six.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: The field of fire is too heavy.  Back off and pinpoint their positions.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Hunt's heading for the bridge.  Coming in at twelve o'clock high.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Clear that bridge for me.

Speaker: luther' voice
Dialogue: Roger that.

Speaker: billy's voice
Dialogue: They're tracking you on the left, Ethan. Prepare for some fire.

Speaker: gps computer
Dialogue: The target is located.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Ethan, the computer's up.  I've got Nyah. She's moved out of the city.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Luther, say again.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: She's on the North Head Bluff - approaching the cliffs.  One klick away.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Copy.  She's only got twenty-eight minutes left.  Track ahead and pick her up.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: We won't be able to cover you.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You're breaking up.  Track ahead and pick her up.  You've got me on GPS.  Bring her to me.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Billy, North Head.  Haul ass.

Speaker: wallis
Dialogue: Get him.

Speaker: ulrich
Dialogue: I can't get a good shot.

Speaker: wallis
Dialogue: Shut up.  I know what I'm doing.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Range is two kay.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: I hope there's a place to land.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: There she is.  I got visual.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: We're down to seven minutes 23 seconds..

Speaker: luther's voice
Dialogue: Ethan, we've got her.  Tracking to you now. We're reading 5 minutes 19 seconds.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Ethan, we're moments away..

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Go ahead.  Use it Hunt.  It's not a bad way to go.  A lot better than the way that bitch is going to die.

Speaker: ambrose
Dialogue: Hunt.  You should have killed me.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Sorry, Ethan.  I don't quite know where to begin.  Any suggestions?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: You'd like me to conduct my own debriefing.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Why not?  You've done just about everything else on this operation.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I'd thank you -- but I'm not sure that was a compliment.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Of course it was.  Anyone whose operations requires the level of disinformation that yours do, is bound to get a little flak here and there.  You try flogging the stories on CNN I've had to come up with about what's been going on around here the last few days.  At any rate, it's been most instructive -- what they'll swallow, or what they'll broadcast with a straight face.  Miss Hall's blood, it appears, has absolutely no elements of the Chimera virus.  Not even antibodies.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Yes, I gathered as much.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: And the only other remaining sample was in the canister you recover from Ambrose.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: And that appears to have been destroyed. It also contained the anti-virus, Bellerophon.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Well, Bellerophon, it turns out, was only really effective against Chimera.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: But you were under specific instructions to bring back a living sample of the Chimera virus.  I'd be very interested to know how, after you'd managed its recovery intact, it subsequently got destroyed.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: By fire.  That's the best way, really.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: So you didn't fail mission, you simply changed it.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No, I don't.  But in this case -

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: In this case, it wasn't a bad idea.  In face, it was a pretty damn good idea. Just don't make a habit of it.  And, as for Ms. Hall, in light of her efforts, her criminal records will certainly be expunged.  I'm assuming you approve.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Where is she now, by the way?  Do you know?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: I don't.  No exactly.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Well, Hunt, what are your plans?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Not sure.  Some sort of vacation.  I'll let you know where I'm going.

Speaker: swanbeck
Dialogue: Oh, you don't have to do that. Wouldn't be a vacation if you did.

Speaker: sky newscaster
Dialogue: This incident in the wake of rumors suddenly surfacing about Mr. McCloy and Biocyte's financial difficulties -- including criminal allegations of insider trading, embezzlement, conspiracy to commit fraud, and stock parking -- have, understandably, sent stock prices of the pharmaceutical company plummeting.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: So what did he say?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Good job.  And thanks.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: That's it?  That's it? That's it?

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: And the check's in the mall.

Speaker: billy
Dialogue: Right.  Just remember, mates.  Billy Baird's the name.  Anything you need to get, move or watch, I'm your man.

Speaker: luther
Dialogue: Always nice hearing from you man.  Stay in touch..

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Do you know me?

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No.  Should I?

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: No.  You just looked as if you did.

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: No...

Speaker: nyah
Dialogue: Oh.  Well..

Speaker: ethan
Dialogue: Let's get lost.
